Job Title: Mechanical Process Engineer - Water Treatment

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Senior Mechanical and Piping Engineer
Location: East Coast in the U.S. with the ability to travel on site up to 25%
ARE YOU READY TO TRANSFORM AN INDUSTRY?At 374Water, our mission is to preserve a clean and healthy environment that sustains life. Our revolutionary AirSCWO technology transforms the most complex wastes - such as biosolids, microplastics, drugs, and PFAS - to clean water, energy, and minerals. We are pioneering a new era of sustainable waste management that supports a circular economy and enables organizations to achieve their sustainability goals. 374Water is a public cleantech company, innovating in the water and waste industries.

JOB SUMMARYAs a Senior Mechanical and Piping Engineer, you will contribute to the development of equipment for AirSCWO systems. This will require you to develop a thorough understanding of 374’s AirSCWO process and contribute to its continual improvement.You will be part of a small, but growing, engineering team and will work directly with 374’s fabrication partner, equipment suppliers, and AirSCWO system end-users.To be a successful candidate, you must have experience designing and working with equipment for high pressure applications and good knowledge of industry-standard equipment.WHAT YOU’LL DODesign new or optimize existing mechanical equipment in 374’s AirSCWO process.Create or manage creation of 3D and construction drawings.Define pressure equipment and piping requirements, specifications. Perform piping layout and design.Manage and oversee procurement of pumps, heat exchangers, pressure vessels, and related equipment. Quality control activities relating to pressure vessel design and certification.Create technical documentation.
WHO YOU AREQualifications and ExperienceBS in Mechanical Engineering or relevant field. MS preferred, but not required5+ years' experience as a mechanical engineer or equivalent.In-depth knowledge of: pumps, heat exchangers, pressure vessels, valves.Knowledgeable about pressure vessel codes and standards.Preferred knowledge of metallurgy.Proficient with computer design and drawing software such as AutoCAD or Solidworks.Experience in water/wastewater industry and/or hydrothermal operations or other relevant engineering experience. Experience working in a fast-paced environment with multiple, tight deadlines.
SKILLSOrganized with excellent time management skills and able to prioritize workloads efficiently with an uncompromising approach to completing tasks to a high-quality standard.Thrives in a fast-paced environment, enjoys working to tight deadlines, embraces challenges and is dedicated to seeing projects through to satisfactory completion.Outstanding written and verbal communication with the ability to produce well compiled documents.Comfortable working remotely, dependable while working in a fast-paced, open-minded, international team.Motivated by making a positive environmental impact.Great team player, exceptional social and interpersonal skills. Critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTSThis position requires, close vision, and dexterity with fingersThis position requires an individual to sit for long periods of time using a computer, stand, and move about the facilityAbility to lift 20 lbs

WHAT WE OFFERInnovate for global change in a company where your work matters. Worldwide impact with a clear vision, mission, and values-driven culture.Cutting-edge technology that is making an impact on the environment, people, and world.Collaborative working environment with passionate and talented team members. Competitive compensation and benefits package including stock options.Opportunities for growth and learning.We support our team by providing flexible work options and a focus on work-life balance. 

374Water is an equal-opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status.
Visit our Careers page at www.374water.com to apply.

Experience Level (if available): None
